intro: Tovomita bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia tovomita, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it has attracted attention from botanists and horticulturists.
